title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: The BidiUtil class in win32 uses Class.forName() and should have a private constructor.
OB: The BidiUtil class in win32 currently uses Class.forName() for some purpose.
EB: The expected behavior is to add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. There are no non-static methods in this class, so it would be a good practice to make the constructor private to prevent unnecessary instantiation of the class. This change does not add any size to the class, as the compiler provides a free public constructor by default. Making the constructor private is a better design choice.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Access the BidiUtil class in a win32 environment.
2. Examine the class's structure and code to find the usage of Class.forName().
